revised_title: Effects of D-Xyloketose and Root Exudates on Plant Extension Growth
tldr: The authors investigated the effects of D-xyloketose and certain root exudates on the extension growth of plants, specifically peas and maize. They found that these substances promote both longitudinal and lateral extension in root segments. The study also showed that the activity of these substances is destroyed by heat and decreases during storage, suggesting they may be carbohydrates or simple derivatives.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
